item.title: S&P 500 Analysis December 2018
item.description: In the last post we discussed the recent sell off in the US equity markets. In this post we will dig deeper and see how individual components of the market performed this year. First we will begin by looking at the components that make up the S&P 500 index and the returns for 2018. S&P 500 Components {"x":{"filter":"none","caption":"S&P 500 Components Data","data":[["Microsoft Corporation","Apple Inc.","Amazon.com Inc.","Berkshire Hathaway Inc.

item.title: Red October
item.description: For the third quarter of 2018 S&P 500 rallied almost 8.5% and was up almost 10% for 2018. But all that has changed since the beginning of Q4 2018 in October. We will begin by looking at the yearly performance of S&P 500 so far. As we can see that October saw a severe fall in stock market price. We lost almost 10% and wiped off all the gains for the year.

item.title: S&P 500 Analysis
item.description: How has S&P 500 performed so far in 2018. We can start by looking at the S&P 500 chart below. We can see from the chart that the S&P 500 is up about 6.5% since January. The price action in this chart has been sideways. We are stuck in a range 250 and 285. After big gains in 2017 the market seems to be consolidating at these new all time highs.
